children.subject: You may see the history enrollment record on berkeleytime.com

It might be harder than in the past though.  Phase 1 units until just last semester was only 10.5 units I believe.  Now it is 13.5, so every one can phase 1 three separate classes.  (Unfortunate for underclassmen trying to enroll in upperdivs).

This semester, many previous classes that never filled up in phase 1, completely filled.  At least I observed this among CS and Math classes.

Mhm, my vague understanding (not having tried to enroll in many math courses myself) is that, historically, it hasn't been that hard to get into math classes. But if the department is trying this new policy, it seems like it might be harder now (to the point that they're concerned), and the timing coincides suspiciously with the phase 1 enrollment unit cap change last semester.
As a freshman EECS major, is it highly unlikely that I can get into one of these classes, since our Phase 2 enrollment time is really late?
Does this policy save seats for EMS majors?

After I got all majors' advisors to sign off on my forms, and then met with an L&S advisor, I think I was told that it would take a few (~3) weeks for the application to process.

So, sure, you should be able to phase 1 those courses.

I'm already declared in LS CS, and I'm considering double majoring in math in the next week. Once I submit my form, ~ how long will it take to get in the major? If I get in can I phase 1 ud math courses?
If there are waitlist seats available, it's still better to add myself to the waitlist rather than wait for phase 2 right?

history.content:
The Math Department has decided that during "Phase 1" of registration, seats in the following five "core" upper-division courses will be saved for students who are declared in Mathematics or Applied Mathematics as well as for undeclared students in the College of Letters & Science:
Math 104: Introduction to Analysis
Math 110:  Linear Algebra
Math 113:  Introduction to Abstract Algebra
Math 128A:  Numerical Analysis
Math 185:   Complex Analysis
Graduate students, undergraduates from outside of Letters & Science, and declared Letters & Science students who aren't double or triple majoring with Math would need to wait until Phase 2 to add these courses.  
We don't know any details about this policy. Please direct questions to the math department.
history.subject: Sharing new math dept enrollment policy
